alert.note: Alert for Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 11:29PM EDT until July 15 at 1:45AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Morris County in northern New Jersey... Central Warren County in northwestern New Jersey... Northeastern Northampton County in eastern Pennsylvania... * Until 145 AM EDT. * At 1129 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported flash flooding in Lower Mont Bethel Township and Washington Township in Northampton County. Between 2 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 inches in 1 hour. Although the heaviest rain has left the warned area, additional light rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible. Additionally, it will take time for runoff to recede. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Easton, Hackettstown, Washington, Bangor, Pen Argyl, Wind Gap, Belvidere, Harmony, Oxford, Hope, Belfast, and East Bangor. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 2 and 12. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
